list_definition.definition: the part farthest from the middle of something; a border

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Don’t put that cup so near the edge of the table – it will fall off
We went down to the river and sat by the water’s edge.

list_definition.definition: the cutting side of something sharp, eg a knife or weapon

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The edge of that kitchen knife is extremely sharp.
The chocolate took the edge off his hunger.

list_definition.definition: to move or push little by little

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He edged his chair nearer to her
She edged her way through the crowd.
